alert.note: Alert for Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 8:46PM EST until February 02 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CST/1145 PM EST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Coffee, Dale, Henry and Houston. In southwest Georgia, Clay, Early, Quitman and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CST /1145 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM CST /846 PM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daleville, Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Georgetown, Dothan, Ozark, Fort Rucker, Enterprise, Midland City, Kinsey, Level Plains, Newton, Webb, Pinckard, Grimes, Newville, Napier Field and Bellville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
